summary: This document is an email chain from December 15, 2021, between law enforcement officers. It details an investigator's attempts to contact an unnamed individual (referred to as 'him' and 'he') regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The individual's wife or a female associate at his phone number stated he did not wish to speak, was not a witness, and was not scheduled to testify for the defense.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by the female contact as the reason for the investigator's call; he is the central figure in the case being investigated.

events.title: Initial contact attempt
events.description: An investigator called a phone number associated with an unnamed individual and spoke with an unnamed female who said the individual was not home and she would pass along a message.

events.title: Follow-up call and refusal
events.description: The investigator called again and spoke with the same female, who stated the individual did not want to talk, was not a witness, had nothing to say, and was not scheduled to testify for the defense in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively attempting to contact a potential witness or associate in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of December 2021.
The individual, through a female contact, explicitly refused to cooperate, stating he was 'not a witness to anything' and had 'nothing to say.'
The female contact proactively asked if the investigation was about Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the case's notoriety.
The female contact stated the individual was not scheduled to testify for the defense, suggesting the investigation was exploring his potential role.
The document shows ongoing investigative efforts by a joint NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
